title: Canada: 'Dozen Bullets' Fired At Hindu Temple Chief's Son's House; Police Mum On Motive | Hindustan Times
text: Explore Search Friday, Dec 29, 2023 New Delhi o C Games E-Paper Sign in My Account Start 14 Days Free Trial Subscribe Enjoy unlimited access Subscribe Now! Get features like Ad lite A Minimal Ad Experience HT Premium Articles Expertly crafted articles Quickreads Segment News brief in summary format HT E-paper Access digital news experience Start 14 Days Free Trial Home Latest News Cricket Education India World Cities Entertainment Lifestyle Astrology Editorials Shop Now 2024 Planner Live Score HT Premium HTCity videos Photos Trending Web Stories Tech Business Sports Delhi News Mumbai News Bengaluru News Quickreads Daily Digest Following IPL Games + 7 more Mumbai News Bengaluru News Quickreads Daily Digest Following IPL Games News / Videos / World News / Canada: 'Dozen Bullets' Fired At Hindu Temple Chief's Son's House; Police Mum On Motive Canada: 'Dozen Bullets' Fired At Hindu Temple Chief's Son's House; Police Mum On Motive world news Published on Dec 29, 2023 12:41 PM IST Follow Us Follow Us Share Via Copy Link Amid a spate of vandalism attacks on Hindu temples in Canada, the head of a Mandir alleged that his son's house in Surrey was targeted by gunmen. Members of the temple had recently opposed a pro-Khalistan protest memorialising Hardeep Nijjar, a designated terrorist in India, who was shot dead in Canada in June. While police are yet to attribute any motive to the alleged gun attack, Satish Kumar suggested that his son's recent insurance business sale could be one of the probable causes. Watch the full video for more.
